title: WHY CAN'T MUNDO SAVE THEM ALL!?
body: The new Mundo lore is not what I expected at all. I love it.

replies.body:
Oh my god I love this new lore.
I mean seriously,Mundo was one of these champs where I feared that Riot might make him either too goofy or too serious(not even necessarily by accident,the 2 can be hard to balance),but I feel like they managed to make him perfect.
He is a rather scary threat to the people,but he is so damm hilarious while trying to "cure" his patients xD

And on top of that,it even explains why Mundo does what he does,besides just "well he is evil,thats why"
Life is affliction, Mundo cure your disease.

As a huge Mundo fan I miss his old lore. The fact that he used to be a super intelligent doctor that kept mutating himself until he turned into a giant silly purple was a good origin and way to keep Mundo interesting. He could have had really good interactions with other smart characters like Heimerdinger or Viktor. "Mundo" they might think. I was also hoping for Mundo and ZAC to have some sort of connection, like maybe Mundo had helped work on ZAC before he totally lost his mind and became a businessman. 

But hey I'm just fanconing out right now.

I'm actually sort of impressed what they did. I always felt there was this disassociation with Mundo: His lore presents him as this sadistic mad scientist who developed his own chemicals that sparked his transformation, while players just saw him as the goofy hulk-expy who goes where he pleases.

Turns out all they needed to do to rectify this was just simply making him a 'Doctor' in name only. One who's convinced the best way to cure his 'patients' is to cleave their head open so all the bad icky sick stuff comes out (Or just to cause them pain, because that's what the doctors did to him, and he loved every minute of it).

EDIT:
I do have a question though, if a rioter would be willing to answer. It seems like Mundo was completely aware of Ekko's time-shenanigans: I was under the impression that, to the outside observer, Ekko just seemed to do things perfectly the first time. Is this just something specific to Mundo, or do I just have the wrong idea about Ekko's Z-Drive?

This was asked on reddit and was not explicitly answered as far as ive seen.  It seems something about Mundo is special (people are suggesting hyper sanity or something).  

On another note I love the idea that even with all his tries, Ekko cannot beat Mundo.  Mundo does what he pleases and no little time punk will stop him.

I thought they fired their lore team a really long time ago to focus on e-Sports? They used to do this journal thing for a "peek behind the scenes" at the heroes every day lives years ago and so forth but then it seemed it all got canned and they just began cranking up the competitive side without any story development at all.
Well perhapse if you got out of maphite arse you would have notice sooner.

This new development actually gives me hope. I used to be really invested in the lore of LoL back in 2009/2010/2011 but when it looked like they sort of dumpstered it and stopped caring, I too, stopped caring. 

I've been hoping for more world building and more reasons to care who these heroes are.

While you were too busy not caring, Riot's been doing just that; more world-building and more reasons to care for League's roster of characters.
So have fun being dumpstered : ^ )

lol? 

I actually like the lore to this game. It's just been woefully neglected and underdeveloped for years with a few bright sparks like the Freljord event and the Shadow Isles event. 

A few blips here and there. It's nice to see they're going into high gear and actually writing this stuff out again.

Ever since bilgewater they've been going from region to region to flesh them out and do a bunch of bios and short stories for the Champions from there.  They did bilgewater shadow isles mt targon shurima piltover and zaun so far.  All in all they've probably revamped about half the lore so far

Eh... sorta.  I mean, it's kinda entertaining but not really DEEP.  "Mundo is a purple orphan (probably?) who likes pain.  No one knows why.  Now he kills everyone while calling himself a doctor.  Also he's really dumb."

Entertaining, but it doesn't really provide any insight at all into him.  Why the hell is he purple and where is he from?  They did they same with the Jinx lore.  She's a mysterious girl from... somewhere... who MIGHT be the same as... someone... maybe.   Nothing about her was answered at all.  Rather disappointing.  Mundo's lore is a LITTLE better... it at least explained why he acts like he does a bit... but it's a far stretch to call it a good story.

Depends on the story some do offer some nice insight or character moments.  Warwicks was pretty nice in how it emphasized his self loathing and gave insight to what he thinks and feels during a hunt for example.

Camilles lore was really nice too. Others like ezreal... eh not so much

Same thoughts here. 
They both come from "somewhere" and no one knows their story. 
I wouldn't call it a bad story at all, because both were well written.
But they were definetly not good storys especially for 2 characters where a little backround insight might have been very interesting.

> But they were definetly not good storys especially for 2 characters where a little backround insight might have been very interesting.

The problem with Jinx is that one of her main story hooks is her origin.

imagine, if you will, that they fully revealed her background.

How interesting is this mystery of why Jinx is harassing Vi if we already know before the story gets fully going.  As disappointing as our lack of knowledge about Jinx's origins are, this does leave them the oppurtunity to drop hints and clues along the way for us to go "WAIT! What if!" as the story progresses.

For Vi's background, it's "what was her life before she lost her memory."  Imagine if they told us that in full when we got her updated bio?

Immediate happiness? Yes.
Feeling of rewards for uncovering her past as the story goes? Not as much.  Because we already knew.

Right? It's, like, the best one they've ever written.
I missed his old Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde theme he had going in his lore, now he is some brute with a desire to cause as much pain as possible.
I'm not aware of any Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde theme in his old lore. He always just liked to fuck people up, even if he had a more scientific theme before.

He used to be a doctor who just wanted to experiment on others for the sake of science and understanding of pain. He ran out of subjects, and experimented on himself thus becomd thie giant purple brute. 

In his JoJ you see the Inquisitor dude allow Mundo to be what he was, so you can see the old Doctor is still alive but trapped in the insanity of the new body.

TAKE TWO AND CALL MUNDO IN THE MORNING!
"Throws huge cleaver at the guy's back"

That one got me too.
His color text made me laugh so hard. I've never really cared much for Dr. Mundo, but with this lore update, I might have to start playing him.
If i ain't wrong, the guy who wrote mundo's lore is anthony burch.... i hope he doesn't write stories about a single-wheeled robot that can't use stairs anymore.......
